vague_description: The problem involves determining the optimal number of small and large suitcases to maximize snack delivery while adhering to various constraints on suitcase capacities and preferences.
detailed_description: A snack exporter sends snacks to his customer in small and large suitcases. A small suitcase can hold \param{SmallCapacity} snacks while a large suitcase can hold \param{LargeCapacity} snacks. Most customer prefer small suitcases, and so at least \param{RatioSmallToLarge} times as many small suitcases must be used as large suitcases. The exporter has available at most \param{MaxSmallSuitcases} small suitcases and \param{MaxLargeSuitcases} large suitcases. If he must send at least \param{MinLargeSuitcases} large suitcases and can send at most \param{MaxTotalSuitcases} suitcases in total, how many of each should he send to maximize the total number of snacks that can be delivered?
target_objective: Maximize the total number of snacks that can be delivered
target_constraints: Number of small suitcases is non-negative
Number of large suitcases is non-negative
Number of small suitcases used must be at least RatioSmallToLarge times as many as large suitcases
At most MaxSmallSuitcases small suitcases are available
At most MaxLargeSuitcases large suitcases are available
At least MinLargeSuitcases large suitcases must be sent
At most MaxTotalSuitcases suitcases can be sent in total
target_parameters: Ratio of the number of small suitcases to the number of large suitcases
Maximum number of small suitcases available
Maximum number of large suitcases available
Minimum number of large suitcases that must be sent
Maximum total number of suitcases that can be sent
